pageContent: Purpose: Evaluating quality of life outcomes following prostate cancer treatment is important because different treatments provide similar survival outcomes. A wide variety of quality of life surveys are used with an unknown correlation between domain specific and broad domain instruments. We compared the urinary and sexual outcome measures of the Expanded Prostate Cancer Index Composite, a broad domain instrument, to those of the Incontinence Symptom Index and the Sexual Health Inventory for Men, which are domain specific instruments.

metaData.source:
Genitourinary functioning and depressive symptoms over time in younger versus older men treated for prostate cancer
https://pubmed.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/20703840/
